snippet: Using data to identify potential start-up founders casts a wider net to find the next person who might have a billion-dollar idea.
abstract: The Upshot; study by researchers at University of California, Berkley, Haas School of Business finds most tech start-up founders are older, with more education and work experience, than previously assumed; Bloomberg Beta, tech investment firm, had teamed with Haas researchers to create program Future Founders, which could identify for venture capitalists entrepreneurs likely to succeed; research findings broaden pool.
lead_paragraph: Using data to identify potential start-up founders casts a wider net to find the next person who might have a billion-dollar idea.

headline.print_headline: Some Venture Capital Firms Set Out to Cast a Wider Net
headline.main: The Next Mark Zuckerberg Is Not Who You Might Think
